results.title: Aftermath: the defence against disaster
results.brief_description: Civil defense workers carry no guns. Their job is to help where tragedy has become personal reality. This film shows the activities, training and operations of civil defence organisations in Australia. The film is designed to assist in training civil defence recruits in all States and to widen appreciation of the need for civil defence preparedness among the general public in times of both peace and war. Adapted from the film “Aftermath” by Film Australia for the Natural Disasters Organization. No other credits available.

results.title: Aftermath
results.brief_description: Dramatisation of a man who has been disabled and put into a wheel chair after an on-the-job accident. It explores his trials and tribulations of adjusting to a new life and facing his family etc. This film is designed to encourage the audience to think seriously about safety. A Teacher’s Guide is supplied. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Afterlife
results.creator_credit: Justin Davies, Rozlyn Clayton-Vincent, Dean Francis and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A female flight attendant on a trans-pacific flight asks the question, “What would you do with the last five minutes of your life?” And sees it answered in the worst-case scenario.
Cast includes Lisa Hensley.

results.title: Afterlife
results.creator_credit: Derek Lamb, ONF | NFB and Ishu Patel
results.brief_description: What is dying? How does it feel? Afterlife is an impressionistic and visionary response to these eternal questions. Based on recent studies, case histories, and some of the ancient myths, the afterlife state is portrayed as an awesome but methodical working-out of all the individual’s past experiences. Music performed by Herbie Mann. Nine awards including Montreal, Chicago, Hong Kong, Annecy and Columbus.
